data.title: Two guys snuck into the Astrodome in 2012, pics
meta_keywords: Two guys snuck into the Astrodome in 2012
data.meta_description: Two guys snuck into the Astrodome in 2012, pics - Thats cool. I had several years of season tickets there. Always spent the game in Lefty&#39;s Pub watching one of my
data.text:
re: Two guys snuck into the Astrodome in 2012, pics

to Lester Earl

Posted by tiggerthetooth

Big Momma's House

Member since Oct 2010

61798 posts

to Lester Earl

Thats cool. I had several years of season tickets there. Always spent the game in Lefty's Pub watching one of my favorite Astros ever: Moises Alou. I miss the Astrodome days.

Posted by VaBamaMan

North AL

Member since Apr 2013

7675 posts

to Lester Earl

I was able to do that in 2003. It was the summer they finished Reliant. I was 17 at the time. Me and a friend snuck in and walked around for about 45 minutes. Actually walked into the guard station and started talking to the guards. After about 10 minutes and asking twice they let us run down on the floor for a few minutes. Ran out to the 50 yard line. Went back to where home plat normally is and mimed playing baseball. Something I will never, ever forget.

Posted by lsusteve1

Member since Dec 2004

42658 posts

to UNO

I've heard they want to make it a possible hotel, convention center, etc.

Houston has Super Bowl in 2017. They'll get upgrade money for Reliant and maybe do something then with the Dome.

Sure hope they keep it in some capacity.

This post was edited on 3/22/15 at 3:49 pm

Posted by Vdrine

Big Bad Baz

Member since Jun 2014

to Lester Earl

This made me think of the movie Brewster McCloud.

quote:

Brewster McCloud is a 1970 movie, directed by Robert Altman, about a young recluse (Bud Cort, as the titular character) who lives in a fallout shelter of the Houston Astrodome, where he is building a pair of wings so he can fly. He is helped by his comely and enigmatic "fairy godmother", played by Sally Kellerman.

to Lester Earl

Harris County demolished the exterior ramps that were added in the late 1980s (so not original).

They have to keep the air conditioning going because of mold issues. I think it's $1 million per year for electric use.
